htmlDescription: A Paladin of Pelor joins the party

eventTitle: Kyris Missing after 6 months in Ophelia's Redoubt

htmlDescription: Looking for Kyris. Traveling to Lakala and Dom Thorim to set up trade for Ophelia's Redoubt

Upon arriving and trying to findKyris DeMowbray, the party discovered there was a slaver ship in the bay. They raided the ship, sunk it, and saved the slaves.

The party dubs themselves as the Crimson Knights
Frozen by a cone of cold, blow apart into a million pieces by Vern
After saving a young girl from slavery, they deliver her to her father inPrilas.

Intent on trying to learn how to forge Adamantine, Balazar requests the party to stop in Dom Thorim so he can learn to smelt the ore into purified bars. The party discovers the place overrun with elemental incursions and offers to help the city in exchange for teaching Balazar how to smelt adamantine
Attempting to stop the Dao incursions into Dom Thorim, the party dives into the underdark to figure out where they are coming from.

eventTitle: Transport into the Dao City, Imosh Jafuh
htmlDescription: The party meets with Lubka, an orc slaver, and schemes with her to get the party into the Crystal Palace so they can destroy the elemental anchor stone.
While escaping the Crystal Palace, Astrazenica is magically turned to stone by a Dao priestess. She still escapes with the party.
As Isabella sacrifices herself to let the party get away, Dismas teleports into the Crystal Palace and destroys the Dao giving chase. He leaves with Isabella
A mercenary withThe Basterdsjoins the party
A cleric of Ioun and a warforged meet the party and beseech their help in finding the Temple of Ioun somewhere on theIsle of Wolves
The party finds passage to and explores theIsle of Wolves. They discover many pieces of Astrazenica's past, includingStormbringer.

The party finds Ioun's temple and is tested by a Gynosphynx. They pass her tests and are granted access to Ioun's library where they learn about The Sundering, The Receedance, the First Heroes, and how the gods were bound usingArelel Eleneth's binding spell. They also learn a second spell was jointly developed by Ioun and Arelel to perform a restoration ritual for the gods. They party also finds Ioun's bound form at the bottom of the temple. The party retrievesDesperation,Stormbringer, and another relic given toAgripina
Using the relic found in Ioun's temple, she restores Astrazenica to life
A traveler from another plane of existence
Searching for a way back home, the party meets a woman named the River Queen who offers to sign the party on as crew to take them south. The party agrees and signs into her service
Aboard the Whisper Wind, the party travels in a southerly direction to Veritas
The party finds out the River Queen is transporting some suspicious cargo. They don't find out much more.
Tipped off by the Kraken fight, she figured out Vern is a former war hero from the war Crales waged a while back.

As the Whisper Wind drew close to Veritas, the ship was ambushed by a group of masked people who were identified as Vern's old colleagues. The River Queen extracted the necessary information out of Vern to track them down. She revealed herself and her crew to be a part of theStarfall Divisionand held the party under strict watch until Vern's colleagues could be apprehended.

eventTitle: Balazar, G, and Aneszka leave the party
htmlDescription: They head back to Ophelia's Redoubt to make sure everything is being well managed over there.
After identifying Vern's colleagues are inside the penitentiary, the party visits them inside. They find out Nekrask has been working on something big and are trying to stop it.
The party finds Nekrask has been working out of the Mossspire Garrison for a while and finds his plans for a super weapon utilizing the unnatural ore the River Queen was transporting to him.
Nekrask set up and activated his super weapon to destroy Vern's colleagues and everything inside the Boulderkeep Penitentiary
Killed by the elementals pouring out of the planar tear used to destroy the Boulderkeep Penitentiary
Killed with Vern.
He has a vision quest to save one of Ioun's chosen, Vern.
The party is attempting to find The Paragon who should be able to resurrect Vern.
Hunted by bounty hunters, Shuyun was sucked into the Astral Plane with the rest of the party and his hunters.

eventTitle: Encountered the Gith and an Astral Dreadnaught

htmlDescription: While the party was trying to resurrect Vern, Nekrask destroyed Vern's hometown of Doncaster.
Battled with her to free her from Tharizdun's clutches

eventTitle: Shuyun absorbs the darkness from Feota

htmlDescription: After loosingStormbringerand Maddox Blackwell to Tharizdun's corpse, Astrazenica attunes herself toDaz'gaarath.
After touching Tharizdun's corpse, Maddox's body is absorbed into the magical binding holding Tharizdun in place.
She was pushed through a portal into Limbo by Adam who didn't want her to bring Daz'gaarathback into the material plane
After meeting and being taken care of by a family of farmers, a knock at the door reveals a very dirty and lost dwarf

eventTitle: Met with the King of Ithrevar
htmlDescription: The party provides him information about Nekrask's plans. They find outThe Basterdhas been appointed to the council atNubrik Nightrock's request
Trying to beat Nekrask there to save their city.
Adam scouting catches a glimpse ofNekraskandKyris DeMowbrayteleporting ahead of them.

using the same teleportation ritual Nekrask used, Vern creates a magical scroll to teleport them to Ophelia's Redoubt. The party spends the day attempting to set up defenses for the city and scouring it for Nekrask.
The party fails to stop Nekrask's weapons and Ophelia's Redoubt is destroyed as a result.

The loss of Doncaster, his family, and the life of his last remaining son at the destruction of Ophelia's Redoubt drives Vern into a mentally broken state. He leaves the party in the middle of the night and was stopped by Adam. Adam tries to convince him to stay and is unsuccessful.
yes, it is an era changing event. She tasks the party to dive beneath the ocean surface in the Bay of Crypts and retrieve a bunch of Brass Dragon scales.

eventTitle: Found an underwater keep dedicated to Pelor
htmlDescription: Now infested with Sehuagin led by a Sehuagin Psionic Priestess. The priestess was imprisoning an older adult bronze dragon namedYlrisdeinthat the party ended up freeing.

eventTitle: Defended Lakala against a Sword Wraith Commander
htmlDescription: Defended and defeated a spirit that has been haunting Lakala for centuries. Spent the night celebrating with Lakala for the Summer Solstice festival.

eventTitle: Beverly tasks the party to kill some trolls

htmlDescription: Franky magically heals Vern's depression to let Vern refocus on the bigger picture.

The party defeats the invading githyanki, including the young red dragon and commander. The Githyanki assassin bartered with the party to return with heads of civilians already killed to pretend she was the only survivor. She took the Githyanki swords with her to prevent the party from being hunted again.

Using magical disguises to pretend they were Shuyun's mother, the tabaxi tried to magically charm and detain Shuyun to lead him back to their ship in the harbor. Shuyun's magical resistance to charm kicked in and he freed himself. He escaped yet another magical paralysis spell and ran to the rooftops. The party confronted the Tabaxi on their ship and captain of the ship denied any fault. The party left suspicious but not before the tabaxi gave Shuyun a coin, "to remember his homeland by."

eventTitle: Pran, The City of Fire overrun by Belial and Fierna
htmlDescription: KingOban Jennonnmade a deal with the devil lords to save the city from one evil and delivering them into the clutches of another

eventTitle: The party meets the remaining King's First batallion
htmlDescription: As the battle with the Githyanki raiders wraps up, the party sees a magical disturbance on the walls. Ten heavily armored individuals step through a couple teleportation spells
Sent to Ophelia's Redoubt by the party to remove the Ophelia's curse and cure her.

Ambushed at night by Tabaxi (who stole Shuyun's equipment), the party attempted to retaliate by dropping a fireball on a ship in the bay. The ship turned out to be a trading vessel that was traveling from theIsle of Shiosharito Lakala. A single tabaxi was on-board but was not the tabaxi that had stolen Shuyun's belongings.

Feeling responsible for the lives lost on the top of the ship, the party messages Franky to get him to turn around. After an "interesting" way of gaining an audience with the crew, the party aligned themselves with the crew ofThe Ferventand its captain,Dondeag Greatbelt. Argos and Vern fetch Franky via flying through the night with successive polymorph and wildshape. Vern casts teleportation circle to bring the party, the ship crew, and Franky back toLakalaso they can find diamonds to resurrect the sailors.

The party meets an interesting looking halfling hanging aroundWilkin Qula's mayoral estate. He introduces himself asZenlan Wildcloak, a member of theKing's First Battalion. The party meets the rest of the King's First:

  1. Zarilius
  2. Jona
  3. Kithgrace Littlefoot
  4. Mira Xiloscient
  5. Merjin
  6. Quinster Quickstep
  7. Thewraek Teinithra
  8. Qidithas
  9. Zenlan Wildcloak
And a member of Council of Ithrevar,The Basterd

The party met a mother gnome and her daughter traveling from Lakala to Ophelia's Redoubt. Imelba had been in contact with her husband, who beseeched her to join him in Ophelia's Redoubt. They party found out the River Queen, operating under the new moniker, The Red Lady of the Sea, has been helping the city rebuild. Hemtust, Imelba's husband, said the River Queen has ordered her soldiers to aid the remaining people there by supplying them with food and water. She has also taken it upon herself and her soldiers to build some monument to those lost when the city was destroyed.

Faced with the massive ironwoods of the Graesh Timberlands ahead of them, the party had difficulty navigating deeper into the timberlands to find the entrance to the Temple of the Cat Lord. Utilizing what they knew best, the party dove straight into the forest, quickly getting lost and turned around.

The party's first encounter with denizens of the Greash Timberlands has been less than ideal. They met a fey creature who promised to lead them through the timberlands to the party's objectives. Unbeknownst to the party, the Darkling elder led them to an ambush. The party quickly dealt with the darklings and found an unexpected ally in the forest, namely a treant by the name of Thistlespur.

Directed by Thistlespur, the party heads deeper into the forest to gain aid from a small group of Dryads who have made their home in the forest. The party came across their grove, which as an unusually close tie to the feywilds, where they met a defender of the grove. The defender turned out to be an eladrin, just finishing her transformation to a Autumn Eladrin. She is adorned in heavy-plate like armor and sword made from the ironwood of the Greash Timberland. After a short conversation and introductions, where they party found out her name wasVallynn Amakiir. When she found out about the import of the party's quest and the danger it poses to the forest, the eladrin extended her assistance to the party.

The party finally came across the first signs of the Cat Lord's temple, a mostly destroyed statue of a cat-like creature. However, this creature had wings and long finger-length teeth filling a wide maw. A brief exploration discovered more statues of similar, but different creatures though harder to make out as the statues were increasingly unfinished. When the party found the entrance to the temple, they were ambushed by a displacer beast and two cheetah-like creatures with manes made of snakes that breathed a sleeping gas from their mouths.

The party found the Temple of the Cat Lord sealed by someone they know as Pouncing Thunder. They also found the temple had been opened, doors were excavated by the tabaxi they are hunting. They descended further into the temple, and found writings on the walls above the previously sealed doors. The writings warned of a great worm that was defending the temple. The party encountered a psychic worm, called the Oculus worm and a small gecko that formed a symbiotic relationship. The Dragon Knights dispatched the Oculus Worm and captured the gecko, but not without expending a large amount of resources. Haggard and bloody, they party continued to descend while Vern tries to form a Familiar bond with the Whisking Gecko.

Past the Oculus Worm, the party utilized a 'Detect Object' spell to identify their quarry continued to descend deeper into the temple. The Dragon Knights find a ancient experimentation chamber blocking their path. A quick inspection of the room shows a pattern the party identifies and opens the center altar to reveal steps that lead below

Behind a charred body and a well-sealed door that has been broken open to reveal another dead body, the party finds a pristine half-dome chamber with a small marble raised dais. A dimple in the top indicated a small, round item used to sit atop it. Utilizing the Mirror of the Past, the party saw the chamber being assembled by Pouncing Thunder, a long long period of stillness, and a group of tunneling kobolds digging their way into the chamber. Examining the chamber and the marble blocks, the party identifies the marble being incredibly strong. Not only that, but Shuyun feels the bead of inverse light flickering while inside the chamber.

The partycrawlsthrough the kobold mines, initially coming across a single Kobold by the name Tin. Fearing for his life, Tin leads the party around a few traps until he finds an opportunity to dart away while the party fights another group of Basilik rider Kobolds, a Kobold Scale Sorcerer, and some Kobold runts. Fighting their way through the pockets of caves and tunnels, the party makes some random choices to descend further into the earth's crust. In one particular encounter with some of the Kobolds, Adam captures the soul of one and peers through is eyes to try to find out what waits for them below. He sees the Kobolds worshiping a form never seen or depicted in history books. A crystalline dragon, armored with amethyst, lies lazily against the back wall of a muggy, large cave illuminated by the flow of lava. The name Pymbosedeonth the Voiceless echoes through Adam's head before the soul is released from the binding of magic.

Pushing further into the underdark, the party passes over rickety bridges over a small underground river and over simple tripwires. They come to a muggy, cooler chamber that holds various types of fungus the Kobolds tend to use for food. They get too close to some fungus, however, which sets off a screeching fungus that echoes throughout the chamber. In their frustration, the party destroys the fungus and the chamber once again falls into silence.

In a humid room where a river of lava boiled a small underground pond, two umber hulks made their lairs. Frustrated and sore from crawling through the Kobold-sized mines, the party noisily makes their way into the room only to be ambushed by the Umber Hulks and some of the sentient fungus growing on the near walls. Dispatching the Umber Hulks left the party in utter exhaustion. With the kobolds hot on their tails, the party decides to barricade this room and attempt to rest.

eventTitle: Rest in the Umber Hulk's Lair
htmlDescription: The party did what they could to barricade the Umber Hulk's lair and tried to get some rest. Unfortunately, the kobolds were persistent in their pursuit and attempted to flush the party out with casks of Rot Grub Swarms and a raiding party of their own. Quickly dispatching both, the party completes their long rest without any additional attempts by the Kobolds.

Descending one more Kobold tunnel, the party comes face-to-face with a long-forgotten and a now unknown dragonkind. The dragon they find before them is not a chromatic or metallic, but instead a amethyst gem dragon known as Pymbosedeonth, the Voiceless. He treats with the party, exhibiting a strange magical prowess unfamiliar to the party. He offers the party what they desire (yes, the artifact) if they in turn perform a favor for him. He tasks the party to infiltrate a aggressively expanding domain of duergar known as the Spikeiron Duergar. They have a forge that is producing powerful weapons and armor that is emboldening the Spikeiron Duergar to get ever closer to Pymbosdeonth's domain. Pymbosedeonth wants the secrets of their forge uncovered and dismantled. Before the party leaves, the ancient gem dragon has a telepathic communication with the guardian of the forest thereafter she declares she will be staying with the dragon while the party moves on. The last the party sees of her before they exit Pymbosedonth's lair is her doffing her armor in front of the dragon.

Quickly, the tunnels the party is traveling down give way to carved out mining tunnels of the Spikeiron Deurgar. The Dragon Knights find the mining tunnels quickly give way to a natural cavern system the Spikeirons use as a main thoroughfare. The Spikeirons, true to their name, spike the corpses of their slain enemies on jagged curved metal pylons as warnings to those that might invade their domain. As the party travels closer to the Duergar's domain, the temperature of the natural cave system begins to rise. Soon, the party finds themselves drenched in sweat. Hearing voices approach, Adam conjures a bat familiar to scout out what is ahead of the party. He sees a warband of Spikeiron Duergar, using Steeder spiders as pack mules, marching through the tunnels towards the party. Standing their ground, the party attacks and destroys the warband but not without a cost. Raz, Argos' Brass Dragon Wymling companion, is slain in the battle.
Slain during the battle with the Spikeiron Duergar warband.

Prior to resting in the safety of Leomond's Tiny Hut, Adam uses the soul he captured during the battle to extract information about the forge. Through the Duergar's eyes, Adam sees a semi-circular room with a large forge centered on the back wall illuminated by twin lava flows on both sides of the room. Halfway submerged in the lava flow on the left side of the room is a caged and restrained Balor demon. Working at the forge is a older female dwarf, streaks of grey peppered through her knotted, dirty, and singed blond hair.

The party comes up with a plan to disable the forge. They choose to send the two stealthiest members, Adam and Shuyun, ahead to kill the dwarf. To aid in the infiltration, the party makes both members invisible and summon eight pixies to help. As the hit-squad makes their way into the Zarintirth Stronghold, they're surprised by warhorns sounding throughout the cavern and many of the visible duergar rushing towards the top of the stronghold. Utilizing this distraction, Adam and Shuyun make their way to the lower entrances after being briefly caught by a wandering patrol. The two of them duck inside and after eliminating a couple guards, they make their way down to the forge. The Balor sees through their invisibility and beseeches them to free him and in return he will grant them anything they desire. Before they're able to interact with the dwarf at the forge, they hear the shouts of guards coming down to the forge. Adam places the immovable rod in front of the door and activates it, buying them enough time to talk to the dwarf. She tells them she's not leaving until she finishes her masterpiece, the Balor attacks Shuyun for not trying to free him, and the Spikeiron Duergar arrive, commanded by a half-mechanical duergar. A fight ensues and the two party members barely escape with their lives. They head back, defeated, to the rest of the party. As they do, they witness factions of deurgar forming and fighting other duergar on all levels of the keep.
